bio:
Mark Sposato is a multidisciplinary graphic designer, art director, filmmaker, and educator at the School of Visual Arts. With over 10 years of experience as an advertising creative, he has a diverse but finely-tuned skill set. Beyond the agency world, he has extensive experience building identity-driven brands for small businesses and film and music projects. He’s the co-founder of a design and content studio called Houndstooth, which focuses on branding, commercial video content, and independent film. Mark’s design work has been recognized by Graphis, HOW, CMYK Magazine, Art Director's Club, Creativity, Creative Quarterly and LogoLounge. He will be featured in an upcoming book about poster design, published by Bloomsbury. He was a guest lecturer at Kean University and a featured panelist at the AICP Basecamp.
|
shortsummary:Award-winning multidisciplinary graphic designer and educator at the School of Visual Arts with 10+ years of experience as an advertising creative. Recognized by Graphis, HOW, CMYK Magazine, Creative Quarterly and LogoLounge.
title: Award-winning multidisciplinary graphic designer and educator; 10+ years of experience as an advertising creative
